abstract.p: Roundup of recent advertising account changes (Advertising column) (S)

block.p: * Fathom, New York, which plans to operate an education Web site at www.fathom.com, named six agencies to handle assignments with billings estimated at $25 million to $30 million. They were Weiss Stagliano Partners, New York, with O'Malley & Hogan, Dublin, Ireland, for branding and advertising; Organic, San Francisco, for Web site development; Clark, Martire & Bartolomeo, Englewood Cliffs, N.J., for market research; Emerging Technology Solutions, Fairfax, Va., part of Veridian Inc., for project management and e-commerce; and Outrider, New York, part of the Tempus Group, for customer marketing.

* MoneyZone.com, Charlotte, N.C., a corporate finance Web site, to Long Haymes Carr, Winston-Salem, N.C., part of the Interpublic Group of Companies, to handle its first account. Spending was estimated at $10 million.
